awd_titl_txt: A Detailed Electron Microscopy, Magnetic Anisotropy, and    X-ray Goniometry Study of the Relationship Between Magnetic and Clay Fabric During Compaction
awd_abstract_narration: Previous work by Ken Kodama has investigated changes in the                     magnetic properties of sediments subjected to various degrees                   of compaction.  Of special interest has been the discovery that                 the paleolatitude signature recorded at the time of gentle                      settling on the seafloor becomes degraded during subsequent                     compaction.  In the present study, Kodama will conduct                          investigations on the microscopic scale to gain an                              understanding of how grain interaction and reorientation                        contributes to this change.  Controlled mixtures of magnetite-                  bearing clays will be subjected to hydraulic loading to imitate                 burial, and relationships between clay fabric, magnetite                        particle alignment, and degree of sediment compaction will be                   examined with electron microscopy and X-ray techniques.
